text.*:
31°
31st meridian east
Map all coordinates using: OpenStreetMap 
Download coordinates as: KML · GPX

The meridian 31° east of Greenwich is a line of longitude that extends from the North Pole across the Arctic Ocean, Europe, Turkey, Africa, the Indian Ocean, the Southern Ocean, and Antarctica to the South Pole.

The 31st meridian east forms a great circle with the 149th meridian west.

From Pole to Pole[edit]

Starting at the North Pole and heading south to the South Pole, the 31st meridian east passes through:

Co-ordinates Country, territory or sea Notes
90°0′N 31°0′E﻿ / ﻿90.000°N 31.000°E﻿ / 90.000; 31.000﻿ (Arctic Ocean) Arctic Ocean
80°10′N 31°0′E﻿ / ﻿80.167°N 31.000°E﻿ / 80.167; 31.000﻿ (Barents Sea) Barents Sea Passing just west of Kvitøya, Svalbard,  Norway
Passing just east of Kong Karls Land, Svalbard,  Norway
70°25′N 31°0′E﻿ / ﻿70.417°N 31.000°E﻿ / 70.417; 31.000﻿ (Norway)  Norway Varanger Peninsula - easternmost point of the country
70°16′N 31°0′E﻿ / ﻿70.267°N 31.000°E﻿ / 70.267; 31.000﻿ (Varangerfjord) Varangerfjord
69°46′N 31°0′E﻿ / ﻿69.767°N 31.000°E﻿ / 69.767; 31.000﻿ (Russia)  Russia
63°18′N 31°0′E﻿ / ﻿63.300°N 31.000°E﻿ / 63.300; 31.000﻿ (Finland)  Finland
